question: Sabka Vishwas scheme, which is in news, is associated to which purpose?
option3: To settle pending indirect tax disputes
option4: To settle pending women related cases
answer: To settle pending indirect tax disputes
explanation: The Government of India (GoI) has recently notified the Sabka Vishwas - Legacy Dispute Resolution Scheme  2019  to reduce legacy service tax and central excise cases in the pre-GST era. The scheme will be operationalized from 1st September 2019 & would continue till 31st December 2019. The two main components of the Scheme are dispute resolution and amnesty. The most attractive aspect of the scheme is that it provides substantial relief in tax dues for all categories of cases as well as full waiver of interest, fine and penalty. For all the cases pending in adjudication or appeal â€“ in any forum - this Scheme offers a relief of 70% from the duty demand if it is Rs.50 lakhs or less and 50% if it is more than Rs. 50 lakhs. The same relief is available for cases under investigation and audit where the duty involved is quantified and communicated to the party or admitted by him in a statement on or before June 30, 2019. The scheme is especially tailored to free the large number of small taxpayers of their pending disputes with the tax administration.
